title: SARS-CoV-2 exhibits intra-host genomic plasticity and low-frequency polymorphic quasispecies
author: Timokratis Karamitros
affiliations: Unit of Bioinformatics and Applied Genomics, Department of Microbiology, Hellenic Pasteur Institute, Athens, Greece 2. 4th Academic Department of Medicine, National and Kapodistrian University of Athens, Medical School, Athens, Greece
Public Health Laboratories, Department of Microbiology, Hellenic Pasteur Institute, Athens, Greece
Applied Genomics Department of Microbiology Hellenic Pasteur Institute 127 Vas. Sophias avenue 11521, Athens, Greece m:
abstract: In December 2019, an outbreak of atypical pneumonia (Coronavirus disease 2019 COVID-19) associated with a novel coronavirus (SARS-CoV-2) was reported in Wuhan city, Hubei province, China. The outbreak was traced to a seafood wholesale market and human to human transmission was confirmed. The rapid spread and the death toll of the new epidemic warrants immediate intervention. The intra-host genomic variability of SARS-CoV-2 plays a pivotal role in the development of effective antiviral agents and vaccines, but also in the design of accurate diagnostics.
